name: Jollof Rice
steps: Blend tomatoes, pepper, and onion into a smooth paste.
Heat oil in a pot and fry the tomato paste for 5 minutes.
Add the blended mix and fry until reduced and dark red.
Add seasoning, salt, and washed rice.
Add water, cover, and cook until rice is soft.

name: Egusi Soup
steps: Heat palm oil, add chopped onions and fry.
Add ground egusi and stir continuously.
Add meat stock and cook for 10 minutes.
Add meat, leaves, seasoning, salt and simmer.

name: Fried Plantain
steps: Peel and slice plantains diagonally.
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Fry plantains until golden brown on both sides.
Drain excess oil and serve.

name: Ofada Sauce
steps: Blend peppers and onions coarsely.
Heat palm oil until bleached.
Add locust beans and blended mix.
Add meat and seasoning.
Cook until oil floats and sauce thickens.

name: Afang Soup
steps: Boil meat with seasoning.
Add chopped waterleaf and cook.
Add afang leaves, periwinkle, crayfish, and palm oil.
Simmer until thick and well combined.

name: Moi Moi
steps: Blend beans, pepper, and onion into a smooth paste.
Add oil, seasoning, and salt.
Pour into containers and add egg if using.
Steam for 45 minutes until firm.

name: Efo Riro
steps: Blend pepper and onion.
Heat oil and fry mixture with locust beans.
Add meat, seasoning, and cook.
Add chopped spinach and simmer.

name: Okra Soup
steps: Boil meat and season.
Add palm oil, crayfish, and okra.
Cook for 10 minutes, then add ugu.
Simmer until soup is thick and okra is soft.

name: Nkwobi
steps: Boil cow foot until tender.
Mix potash in water, add to palm oil.
Stir till thick, add crayfish, pepper, and meat.
Garnish with utazi and serve.

name: Pepper Soup
steps: Boil meat or fish with onion and seasoning.
Add pepper soup spices and cook well.
Add scent leaves and simmer for a few minutes.

name: Tuwo Shinkafa
steps: Cook rice with plenty of water until very soft.
Mash and stir continuously until smooth.
Mold into balls and serve with soup.

name: Miyan Kuka
steps: Boil meat and dry fish with seasoning.
Add palm oil and pepper.
Sprinkle in kuka while stirring.
Simmer until thickened.

name: Banga Soup
steps: Boil palm fruit extract with meat or fish.
Add spices and cook until thick.
Add scent leaves and simmer.

name: Edikaikong
steps: Cook meat and periwinkle with seasoning.
Add waterleaf and cook.
Stir in ugu and palm oil.
Simmer until thick.

name: Yam Porridge
steps: Boil yam with pepper and seasoning.
Add palm oil and crayfish.
Mash part of the yam.
Add vegetables and stir.

name: Peppered Snails
steps: Clean snails thoroughly.
Boil with pepper and seasoning.
Heat oil, fry onions, and add snails.
Stir-fry until well coated.

name: Akara
steps: Soak and peel black-eyed peas.
Blend with onion and pepper into a smooth paste.
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Scoop batter and fry until golden brown.

name: Bitterleaf Soup
steps: Boil meat with seasoning and pepper.
Add palm oil and ground crayfish.
Stir in washed bitterleaf.
Simmer until well combined.

name: Pepper Sauce
steps: Blend peppers and onions into a paste.
Heat oil in a pan, add the blended mix.
Cook until oil separates and sauce thickens.
Season with salt and serve.

name: Nkwobi (Traditional)
steps: Boil cow foot until tender.
Mix potash in water, add to palm oil.
Stir till thick, add crayfish, pepper, and meat.
Garnish with utazi and serve.

name: Catfish Pepper Soup
steps: Clean catfish and cut into pieces.
Boil with onion and seasoning.
Add pepper soup spices and cook well.
Add scent leaves and simmer for a few minutes.

name: Peppered Chicken
steps: Marinate chicken with pepper, onion, and seasoning.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the chicken until golden brown.
Serve hot with your choice of side.

name: Peppered Goat Meat
steps: Boil goat meat with seasoning until tender.
Heat oil, fry onions, and add pepper.
Add the boiled meat and stir-fry until well coated.

name: Peppered Fish
steps: Clean fish and marinate with pepper, onion, and seasoning.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown.
Serve hot with your choice of side.

name: Beans and Corn Porridge (Adalu)
steps: Cook beans until almost tender.
Add corn and continue cooking.
Add palm oil, chopped onions, pepper, and seasoning.
Simmer until soft and thick.

name: Ukodo (Yam Pepper Soup)
steps: Boil goat meat or fish with seasoning.
Add sliced yam and cook until soft.
Add pepper soup spices and scent leaves.
Simmer until flavors blend.

name: Abacha (African Salad)
steps: Soak abacha in hot water and drain.
Mix palm oil and potash water to form a paste.
Add crayfish, pepper, ugba, and seasoning.
Stir in abacha and garnish with onions.

name: Oha Soup
steps: Boil meat and stockfish with seasoning.
Add palm oil and crayfish.
Add cocoyam paste to thicken.
Stir in oha leaves and simmer.

name: Fisherman Soup
steps: Clean and season seafood, cook until tender.
Add palm oil, crayfish, and pepper.
Simmer and finish with scent leaves.

name: Plantain Frittata
steps: Fry sliced plantains until golden.
Whisk eggs with vegetables and seasoning.
Layer plantains in baking dish and pour egg mix.
Bake until set and golden.

name: Achicha (Dry Cocoyam Porridge)
steps: Soak cocoyam flakes in warm water until soft.
Heat oil, add crayfish, ugba, and pepper.
Mix in cocoyam and seasoning.
Add leaves and stir till combined.

name: Nigerian Meat Pie
steps: Cook filling with meat, diced potatoes, and carrots.
Make dough and cut into circles.
Fill and seal each with filling.
Bake until golden brown.

name: Ewa Agoyin
steps: Cook beans until very soft and mash lightly.
Blend pepper and onion coarsely.
Heat palm oil and fry pepper mix until dark and aromatic.
Serve beans with sauce on top.

name: Gizdodo
steps: Fry plantains until golden and set aside.
Sauté onions, peppers, and tomatoes.
Add cooked gizzard and plantains.
Stir and allow flavors to combine.
